item.title: Caroline add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "A year or two younger than his eminently practical friend, Mr. Bounderby looked older; his seven or eight and forty might have had the seven or eight added to it again, without surprising anybody. He had not much hair. One might have fancied he had talked it off; and that what was left, all standing up in disorder, was in that condition from being constantly blown about by his windy boastfulness." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Caroline add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caroline add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caroline add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "We're all human, aren't we? Every human life is worth the same, and worth saving." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caroline add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Let us step into the night and pursue that flighty temptress, adventure." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Sometimes people are beautiful. Not in looks. Not in what they say. Just in what they are." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Like most misery, it started with apparent happiness." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I have hated words and I have loved them, and I hope I have made them right." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Caroline add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Caroline add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Caroline add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbors, and laugh at them in our turn?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is not everyone,' said Elinor, 'who has your passion for dead leaves." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "What are men to rocks and mountains?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Silly things do cease to be silly if they are done by sensible people in an impudent way." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A large income is the best recipe for happiness I ever heard of." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Run mad as often as you choose, but do not faint!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "What strange creatures brothers are!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I am excessively diverted. " -- Jane Austen

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Do you know what breakfast cereal is made of? It's made of all those little curly wooden shavings you find in pencil sharpeners!" -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "So, please, oh please, we beg, we pray, go throw your TV set away, and in its place you can install, a lovely bookcase on the wall." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Eoin Colfer
item.description: "I can't imagine what they're planning. But I can tell you two things. We won't like it, and it won't be legal." -- Eoin Colfer

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Eoin Colfer
item.description: "If I win, I'm a prodigy. If I lose, then I'm crazy. That's the way history is written." -- Eoin Colfer

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Eoin Colfer
item.description: "A CD. How quaint. We have these in museums." -- Eoin Colfer

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Stories never really end...even if the books like to pretend they do. Stories always go on. They don't end on the last page, any more than they begin on the first page." -- Cornelia Funke
